SENT.plain: Longer existing atherosclerotic lesions may contain calcifications; lamellar bone rarely develops within them
A 59-year-old man was referred with a progressive stroke
A high-grade stenosis of the left common carotid artery, formed by an ulcerating atherosclerotic plaque with a free-floating thrombus, was detected on angiography
Surprisingly this plaque contained pieces of lamellar bone, proved by histologic examination
